subject: Self Care
title: Attention and Focus
description: A quick win: understand Attention and Focus.

hook.text: The average attention span for a task has dropped to 47 seconds. Meditation is one proven way to fix that.

buildup.text: Meditation trains sustained attention. Each time you notice wandering and return, the focus muscle grows.

discovery.text: Studies show meditators outperform non-meditators on sustained attention tasks after just four days.

twist.text: The benefit isn't never getting distracted. It's noticing distraction faster and returning sooner.

climax.text: In a world designed to fragment your attention, meditation is the counter-technology that rebuilds it.

punchline.text: Meditation doesn't prevent distraction. It speeds recovery.

quiz.question: How quickly can meditation improve sustained attention?
options: Measurable improvements in as few as four days
